Sentence: The gods heard his (man) subjects' pleas and decided to keep Gilgamesh in check by creating a wild man named Enkidu, who was as magnificent as Gilgamesh
Enkidu became Gilgamesh's great friend, and Gilgamesh's heart was shattered when Enkidu died of an illness inflicted by the gods
Enkidu is outraged by what he (hunter) hears about Gilgamesh's excesses, so he (hunter) travels to Uruk to challenge him (hunter)
Gilgamesh and Enkidu decide to steal trees from a distant cedar forest forbidden to mortals
Gilgamesh and Enkidu wrestle with the bull and kill it
Gilgamesh can't stop grieving for Enkidu, and he (god) can't stop brooding about the prospect of his (god) own death
